body.p: Georgetown native and Logan County resident. Attended Georgetown College and Kentucky Military Institute. Commissioned Colonel of the Twenty-sixth Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, U.S.A. on August 26, 1861. Promoted to Brigadier General of Volunteers on June 9, 1862 and brevetted to Major General of Volunteers on July 4, 1864. Commanded the Military District of Kentucky in the Department of the Ohio from August 7, 1864 to February 1865. Resigned his commission in December 1865.
